summary: People in the country hoped to earn a steady payout from Wi-Fi hot spots. But many are left holding useless hardware.
title: Helium’s IoT-Crypto Network Is Barely Hanging On in Lebanon
detailed_content: IN THE REMOTE mountain village of Zaarouieh, about an hour’s drive south of Beirut, Ahmed Abu Daher stands on the roof of a half-built house overlooking a wooded valley. He gestures at a drab gray box about the size of a takeout container. A couple of wires emerge from it, snaking off across the bare concrete.
author: BY JACOB RUSSELL
